item.title: 有迹象表明政府停摆正在损害经济，国债上涨
item.description: 由于有证据表明美国政府停摆可能会抑制经济活动，交易员们对此做出了反应，周五国债走高。【原文：Treasuries advanced Friday as traders reacted to evidence the US government shutdown may be curtailing economic activity.】

item.title: 高盛分析：美国初请失业金人数增至23.5万
item.description: 根据高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Applications for US unemployment benefits rose last week, according to a Goldman Sachs Group Inc. analysis of state-level filings released during the federal government shutdown.】

item.title: 铅价摆脱创纪录的预定交货库存的影响
item.description: 由于全球库存仍接近 12 年来的最高水平，伦敦金属交易所新加坡仓库的订单创下了历史新高，交易商们摆脱了压力，铅价随之下跌。【原文：Lead prices fell as traders shrugged off record orders from London Metal Exchange warehouses in Singapore, with global stockpiles still near a 12-year high.】

item.title: Adnoc Gas 首席执行官表示，创纪录的液化天然气浪潮将催生长期需求
item.description: Adnoc Gas 公司的一位高管表示，到本世纪末，液化天然气的供应量将急剧增加，这将带来持续不断的需求。【原文：A looming surge in liquefied natural gas supply through the end of the decade is poised to create demand that won’t go away, said an Adnoc Gas executive.】

item.title: 中国反击美国港口收费，航运市场陷入困境
item.description: 在中国政府对美国船只实施报复性征税之后，一些向亚洲第一大消费国运送原油和其他商品的中国航线船只面临取消，这在全球物流业掀起了涟漪。【原文：Some China-bound ships carrying crude oil and other commodities to Asia’s top consumer are facing cancellations following Beijing’s retaliatory levies on American vessels, sending ripples through the global logistics sector.】

item.title: 加拿大就业人数增加 6.04 万人，失业率维持在 7.1
item.description: 加拿大经济增加的就业岗位多于预期，但失业率保持稳定，因为有更多的人加入了劳动力大军。【原文：The Canadian economy added more jobs than expected but the unemployment rate held steady as more people entered the workforce.】

item.title: 加拿大赴美旅游人数连续第九个月下滑
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的贸易战和边境打压政策的影响下，上个月加拿大赴美旅游人数继续急剧下降。【原文：Canadian travel to the US continued its steep decline last month amid President Donald Trump’s trade war and border crackdown.】

item.title: 可可需求下滑，创 1999 年以来最长周跌幅
item.description: 尽管供应前景有所改善，但需求持续疲软，纽约可可期货将创下 26 年多来最长的周跌幅。【原文：Cocoa futures in New York are set for their longest run of weekly losses in more than 26 years, weighed by continuing demand weakness even as the supply outlook improves.】

item.title: 卢拉推出住房融资计划，着眼于巴西 2026 年大选
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）将宣布一项新计划，以更低廉的信贷刺激巴西的住房市场，继续努力在 2026 年竞选连任之前巩固自己的声望。【原文：President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva will announce a new plan to boost Brazil’s housing market with cheaper credit, continuing his efforts to shore up his popularity ahead of a 2026 reelection bid.】

item.title: 土耳其 5000 亿美元黄金囤积令抗击通胀形势更加复杂
item.description: 黄金价格的上涨使土耳其家庭的财富增加了数十亿美元，从而使中央银行控制价格的努力变得更加复杂。【原文：A rally in gold prices is lifting the wealth of Turkish households by billions of dollars, complicating the central bank’s efforts to rein in prices.】

item.title: 宾夕法尼亚州希望离开美国最大的电网。这并不容易。
item.description: 当宾夕法尼亚州、新泽西州和马里兰州的公用事业公司建立起今天美国最大的电网时，他们的目标是以尽可能低的价格提供电力。但近 70 年后，确保电力供应的成本已飙升至历史新高，这促使宾夕法尼亚州州长乔希-夏皮罗（Josh Shapiro）威胁要退出这个目前由 13 个州组成的电网。【原文：When utilities from Pennsylvania, New Jersey and Maryland established what is today the largest US grid, they aimed to provide power at the lowest possible price. But nearly 70 years later, the cost of securing power has surged to record highs, prompting Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro to threaten to leave the now-13-state network.】

item.title: 杰克-多西的区块链公司在最新行动中瞄准银行卡网络收费
item.description: 杰克-多尔西（Jack Dorsey）的 Block 公司正在重新推动更多商家使用其支付网络，并将其视为信用卡巨头维萨卡公司（Visa）和万事达卡公司（Mastercard Inc.【原文：Jack Dorsey’s Block Inc. is making a renewed push to get more merchants using its payments network, which it casts as a less expensive alternative to credit-card behemoths Visa Inc. and Mastercard Inc.】

item.title: 沃勒称就业市场最令人担忧，薪资可能为负值
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）表示，过去几个月的就业增长可能一直是负增长，劳动力市场现在是他最担心的问题。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said job growth has probably been negative for the last few months and the labor market is now his biggest concern.】

item.title: 德国称中国稀土出口限制引发 "极大关注
item.description: 德国表示，中国越来越多地限制对技术产业至关重要的矿产出口，这令人 "极为担忧"，中国必须减少对欧洲经济区以外供应的依赖。【原文：Germany said China’s increasing restrictions of exports on minerals critical to the technology industry are of “great concern” and the country must reduce its dependence on supplies from outside of the European economic area.】

item.title: 以下是马来西亚 2026 年支出计划的赢家和输家
item.description: 随着政府增加现金发放，以缓解生活成本上升对公民的影响，马来西亚的消费和旅游相关公司将获得提振。【原文：Malaysia’s consumption and tourism-related companies are set to get a boost as the government increases cash handouts to cushion the impact of higher cost of living on citizens.】

item.title: 黄金热潮使印度家庭库存增至近 3.8 万亿美元
item.description: 据一份报告称，印度家庭持有的 34,600 吨黄金（重量超过 6,000 头大象）在最近创纪录的涨势之后价值攀升，见证了印度家庭财富的跃升。【原文：Indian households are witnessing a jump in wealth after their 34,600 tons of gold holdings — weighing more than 6,000 elephants — have climbed in value following the recent record rally, according to a report.】

item.title: 德国称中国新的稀土限制措施 "非常令人担忧
item.description: 德国经济部发言人在一封电子邮件中说，中国将出口管制扩大到中国以外的生产设施，这是德国和欧盟层面正在讨论的一个问题。【原文：China’s expansion of export controls to production facilities outside of China is a concern being discussed in Germany and at the EU level, a spokesperson for the German Economic Ministry said in an email.】

item.title: 中国展示铁矿石购买力可能为时已晚
item.description:
就在其主导地位开始受到威胁之际，北京开始在铁矿石市场大展拳脚。【原文：

Beijing is starting to throw its weight around in the iron ore market, just as its dominant position is starting to look under threat.

】

item.title: 科恰尔斯基试图降低波兰快速降息的预期
item.description: 波兰决策者切扎里-科恰尔斯基（Cezary Kochalski）希望降低交易商对进一步降息的预期，称本周的降息大幅限制了2025年进一步宽松的空间。【原文：Polish policymaker Cezary Kochalski wants to scale down traders’ expectations regarding further interest rate cuts, saying this week’s reduction substantially limited room for further easing in 2025.】

item.title: 作家佩珀将科幻小说视为 "想象力的瑜伽
item.description: 欢迎收看《深度科技》（Tech In Depth），这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，Ellen Huet 将与科幻小说作家 Eliot Peper 谈论科技领袖对科幻题材的兴趣。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ellen Huet talks with science fiction author Eliot Peper about the interest tech leaders have in the sci-fi genre.】

item.title: 政府关门给美国经济带来阵痛涟漪
item.description: 我是驻华盛顿的白宫和国内政策记者格雷戈里-科特。今天我们关注美国政府关门对经济的影响。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册接收本新闻通讯，可以在这里注册。【原文：I’m Gregory Korte, White House and domestic policy reporter in Washington. Today we’re looking at how the US government shutdown is affecting the economy. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 中国竞争白热化，Blackrock 支持的秘鲁铜港将扩建
item.description: 拉丁美洲最大的铜运输枢纽贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：Latin America’s top copper-shipping hub — co-owned by BlackRock Inc. — has secured approval for a $700 million expansion as it seeks to retain a key Chinese customer.】

item.title: 美元无视所有厄运与悲观呼声
item.description:
今年早些时候，投资者排队押注美元贬值。现在，势头正在向有利于美元的方向转变。【原文：

Investors lined up earlier this year to bet against the US dollar. Now, momentum is shifting in favor of the greenback.

】

item.title: 法国建筑业巨头在困境重重的法国之外找到解脱之道
item.description: 法国最大的建筑公司正摆脱国内政治动荡的影响，进一步远离面临投资放缓和高税收威胁的国内市场。【原文：France’s biggest construction companies are shrugging off the political turmoil in the country as they move further away from a domestic market facing slower investment and the threat of higher taxes.】

item.title: 斯特兰蒂斯联盟在痛苦的改革中担心法国的利益
item.description: Stellantis NV 的全面改革引发了法国工人的担忧，他们担心新任首席执行官安东尼奥-菲洛萨（Antonio Filosa）在推动这家陷入困境的汽车制造商重回正轨的过程中将失去在法国的业务。【原文：Stellantis NV’s overhaul is sparking worries among French workers that operations in that country will lose out in new Chief Executive Officer Antonio Filosa’s push to get the struggling carmaker back on track.】

item.title: 销售旺季伊始，特斯拉中国出货量上升
item.description: 随着中国汽车市场进入销售旺季，汽车制造商开始为实现年度目标进行最后冲刺，特斯拉公司上海工厂的出货量在9月份有所增加。【原文：Shipments from Tesla Inc.’s Shanghai factory increased in September as China’s car market kicks off its busy sales period and automakers start their final push to meet annual targets.】

item.title: 期权交易员正以罕见的速度转变为欧元的反对者
item.description: 由于法国政局动荡，期权交易商对欧元采取了几个月来最看跌的立场，本周欧元情绪急剧恶化。【原文：Sentiment toward the euro soured sharply this week as turbulent French politics prompted options traders to take the most bearish stance on the currency in months.】

item.title: 越南放开黄金市场，但因价格下跌购物者暂停购物
item.description: 在河内最繁忙的黄金交易街上，数十家店面的金条和珠宝闪闪发光。然而，周五，店主们闲坐在玻璃柜台后面，等待着顾客，因为越南结束了对金条贸易和生产长达数十年的垄断，这是十多年来市场的首次重大自由化。【原文：Along Hanoi’s busiest gold trading street, dozens of storefronts gleam with bullion bars and jewelry. On Friday, however, shopkeepers sat idly behind glass counters, waiting for customers as Vietnam ended its decades-long monopoly on bullion trade and production, the first major liberalization of the market in more than a decade.】

item.title: Wizz Air 在阿布扎比停业后重新安置约 200 名工人
item.description: Wizz Air Holdings Plc 计划将因阿布扎比业务关闭而受到影响的 450 名工人中的近一半重新安置到东欧的枢纽。【原文：Wizz Air Holdings Plc plans to relocate almost half of the 450 workers affected by the closing of its Abu Dhabi operation to hubs across eastern Europe.】

item.title: 欧洲央行官员警告资产价格估值过高
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员何塞-路易斯-埃斯克里瓦和马丁斯-卡扎克成为最新一批对浮躁的资产价格所带来的日益增长的风险发出警告的央行行长。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council members José Luis Escrivá und Martins Kazaks became the latest central bankers to warn of the mounting risks posed by frothy asset prices.】
